# Creating the sticker

This is a short tutorial to easily create your own stickers!

Let's give it a try for this group and find our identity! ðŸ™ƒ

## 00. Libraries

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| message: false

library(tidyverse)
library(magick)
library(hexSticker)
library(sysfonts)

```

## 01. Prepare images

```{r}
image_networking <- magick::image_read('../images/networking.png')
hub <- magick::image_read("../images/hub.png")
calendar <- magick::image_read('../images/calendar.png')
dinosaur <- magick::image_read('../images/dinosaur.png')
footprint <- magick::image_read('../images/footprint.png')

```

## 02. Load fonts

```{r}

fonts <- font_files()

# Check font paths
# font_paths()

# Add the font we want
font_add(family = "Bahnschrift", regular = "C:\\Windows\\Fonts\\bahnschrift.ttf")

```

## 03. Stickers

### Defining colors palette
```{r}
# define pallete
palette <- list('background' = '#d8f3dc',
                'font' = '#372549',
                'border' = '#372549',
                'note' = 'grey25')

# Single Palette elements
background_color = '#edf2f4'
font_color = "#663091"
border_color = "#264653"
note_color = "black"

```

### Statasaurus logo
```{r}
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false

statasaurus <- sticker(
  # Title
  package = "statasaurus",
  # Title attributes
  p_family = "Bahnschrift",
  p_color = font_color,
  p_size = 21,
  p_y = 0.6,
  # Image
  subplot = dinosaur,
  # Image attributes
  s_width = 0.95,
  s_height = 0.95,
  s_x = 1,
  s_y = 1.2,
  # Hexagon attributes
  h_fill = background_color,
  h_color = border_color,
  h_size = 2,
  # Add a link
  url = "image: Flaticon.com",
  u_size = 5,
  u_color = note_color,
  # Add spotlight
  spotlight = F,
  # Spotlight attributes
  # add some shadow to the pictures
  l_y = 1,
  l_width = 3,
  l_height = 3,
  l_alpha = 0.5,
  # File saving
  filename = "statasaurus_logo.png",
  dpi = 300,
  white_around_sticker = FALSE
  ) 



```

::: panel-tabset
## Final logo

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| eval: true

statasaurus %>% print()

```
:::
